correction_response:
This tweet is misinformed. Educational institutions are not generally considered HIPAA-covered entities. HIPAA applies to health plans, health care clearinghouses, and health care providers who electronically transmit health data. Therefore, your professor did not break HIPAA by informing the class about your COVID-19 status. However, the Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act (FERPA) might apply in this case, which protects the privacy of student education records.

note_1_text: HIPAA applies to healthcare providers and insurers, not professors, so HIPAA has not been violated.    However, this action does appear to violate FERPA policies on student health information privacy in educational settings, which were updated in 2020 regarding COVID.    1. https://www.cdc.gov/phlp/publications/topic/hipaa.html#:~:text=The%20Health%20Insurance%20Portability%20and,the%20patient's%20consent%20or%20knowledge.    2. https://studentprivacy.ed.gov/resources/ferpa-and-coronavirus-disease-2019-covid-19

refute_evidences: - Michael F. Arrigo, an expert witness in various HIPAA-related court cases, said that educational institutions are not generally considered HIPAA-covered entities, as such entities are health plans, health care clearinghouses and health care providers who electronically transmit health data. Reference: https://www.insidehighered.com/news/2020/08/31/colleges-want-professors-stay-mum-student-covid-19-cases published on 2020-08-31 00:00:00

- Brett Sokolow, chair of the campus risk management firm TNG Consulting, also agreed that HIPAA isn’t relevant to COVID-19 student-related notifications. The Family Educational Rights and Privacy Act, or FERPA, which protects the privacy of student education records, probably does apply, though, he added. Reference: https://www.insidehighered.com/news/2020/08/31/colleges-want-professors-stay-mum-student-covid-19-cases published on 2020-08-31 00:00:00

- Standing guidance from the U.S. Department of Health and Human Services says that HIPAA does not apply to elementary and secondary schools. Reference: https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/investigations/2020/08/09/schools-cite-hipaa-hide-coronavirus-numbers-they-cant-do-that/3323986001/ published on 2020-07-17 00:00:00

- Neither HIPAA or FERPA bars schools from releasing such information about school employees. Reference: https://www.usatoday.com/story/news/investigations/2020/08/09/schools-cite-hipaa-hide-coronavirus-numbers-they-cant-do-that/3323986001/ published on 2020-07-17 00:00:00
